Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr

This package contains an expression engine via which lists of DCtxts can be produced by certain rules.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IMExpr
    This expression engine is used by DCtxt.getAll(IMExpr ) and other methods of the DCtxt API to produce a list of contexts.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractMExpr
    This abstract class can be used to implement IMexpr.
    MAnd
    Takes a list of expressions and returns the intersection of the contexts returned by the expressions.
    MChild
    Returns all children of handed in contexts.
    MFrom
    Return all contexts reachable via path.
    MNot
    Returns all contexts that are not returned by the sub expr when fead with these contexts.
    MOr
    Returns the union set of all contexts returned by all given expression.
    MParent
    Returns parents of contexts.
    MRef
    Follows referenced nodes referenced by reference nodes and applies sub expressions.
    MSchema
    Returns contexts of nodes that are bound to a schema node referenced by a certain path after applying sub expressions.
    MTree
    Fetches all valid nodes which are in the trees spanned by the handed in nodes and applies sub expression on them.
    MXPath
    Evaluates an XPath expression relative to the handed in contexts.
    MXPathFilter
    Filters contexts for which an XPath expression evaluates to false.

Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr Description

This package contains an expression engine via which lists of DCtxts can be produced by certain rules.

Expressions are utilized in DCtxt.getAll() and other methods throughout the DCtxt API to produce a list of contexts which then can be iterated: 

        for( DCtxt c : ctxt.getAll( new MXPath( "*[PathType = 'TxPdu']" ) ) ) {
        c.var.setBool( "InterruptMode", true );
        }

The expression engine already provides a set of base expressions all found in the package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.expr that can be combined to more complex expressions. E.g.: 

        ctxt.getAll( new MChild( new MFrom( "Alarm/Counter" ) ) );

The most prominent ones are:

  • MXPath to produce a list of contexts via an XPath epxression
  • MXPathFilter to filter a list of contexts via an XPath expression

The base interface for all expressions is IMExpr. All expressions implement this interface. A more convenient base implementation for expressions is AbstractMExpr.

Filter expressions should provide the following API to allow combination with other filters: 

 ) {
        super();
        ....
        }

        /**
        * @param exprs sub-expressions
        */
        public MFrom( , IMExpr... exprs ) {
        super( exprs );
        ...
        }

        /**
        * @param ctxts input contexts instead of the contexts handed in to the eval method
        * @since 2.1
        */
        public MFrom( , DCtxt... ctxts ) {
        super( ctxts );
        ...
        }

        /**
        * @param expr sub-expressions
        * @param ctxts input contexts instead of the contexts handed in to the eval method
        * @since 2.1
        */
        public MFrom( , IMExpr expr, DCtxt... ctxts ) {
        super( expr, ctxts );
        ...
        }

        /**
        * Maps a list of input context to a list of output contexts.
        *
        * If the expression supports sub-expressions a left associate evaluation should be performed. This means
        * this expressions is evaluated first and the resulting contexts are handed to the sub-expressions. The
        * contexts returned by the sub-expressions are then returned further unreflected by this eval() method.
        *
        * @param contexts The contexts to map
        * @return The new contexts
        */
        public List eval( List contexts ) throws CtxtException {
        // Get input contexts
        contexts = getInputContexts( contexts );
        if( contexts == null || contexts.size() == 0 ) return new Vector();

        // do something
        ...

        // Run sub-expr
        return evalSubExpressions( contexts );
        }

        } // MFrom
        ]]>
